skill.name: Testing Skill
skill.description: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.summary: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no code execution capabilities. The skill provides testing guidance and pytest patterns through markdown documentation only.

content.value_statement: This skill automates test creation and review for pytest projects. It generates test cases, analyzes coverage gaps, and enforces quality standards for codebases.
actual_capabilities: Generate pytest test cases from source code
Review existing tests for quality and coverage
Run coverage analysis with HTML and terminal reports
Execute unit, integration, and e2e test suites
Apply testing patterns including AAA and fixtures
limitations: Does not support other test runners like Jest or JUnit
Requires uv package manager for command execution
Does not generate tests for languages other than Python

use_cases.title: Unit Test Creation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive unit tests with fixtures and assertions for Python functions

use_cases.title: Coverage Analysis
use_cases.description: Identify coverage gaps and enforce minimum 80% coverage standards across the codebase

use_cases.title: CI Pipeline Testing
use_cases.description: Run categorized tests (unit, integration, security) in CI/CD pipelines with coverage reporting

prompt_templates.title: Generate Unit Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate pytest unit tests for the following Python function. Include edge cases, fixtures if needed, and use the AAA pattern (Arrange-Act-Assert):

prompt_templates.title: Check Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run coverage analysis on the codebase. Show which files and lines are missing coverage. Suggest specific tests to add.

prompt_templates.title: Review Test Quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the existing test suite for quality. Check for proper assertions, fixture usage, AAA pattern compliance, and coverage. Report issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Run Security Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the security test suite and generate a report. Include findings on potential vulnerabilities, OWASP compliance, and security testing coverage.

output_examples.input: Generate tests for this authentication module
output: Added fixtures for mock user data and tokens
Missing: edge case for expired token handling

best_practices: Use the AAA (Arrange-Act-Assert) pattern for clear test structure
Create reusable fixtures in conftest.py for common test data
Maintain at least 80% code coverage with branch coverage enabled
Separate tests by category: unit, integration, e2e, security
anti_patterns: Writing tests without assertions or with only pass statements
Hardcoding values instead of using fixtures and parametrize
Skipping coverage requirements for 'complex' code sections
Running all tests without filtering by category (slow, slow)

faq.question: Does this skill work with unittest or other frameworks?
faq.answer: No. This skill is designed specifically for pytest. Other frameworks like unittest or Jest are not supported.

faq.question: What is the minimum coverage requirement?
faq.answer: The skill enforces 80% minimum coverage with branch coverage enabled. Reports show HTML and terminal output.

faq.question: Can I run tests for specific modules only?
faq.answer: Yes. Use pytest path filtering like uv run pytest tests/unit/test_specific.py to run specific test files.

faq.question: Is my test data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. All test execution happens locally using pytest. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are my tests running slowly?
faq.answer: Use pytest markers to filter tests: -m 'not slow' runs fast tests only. Integration tests require external services.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude or Codex testing features?
faq.answer: This skill provides curated pytest patterns, coverage standards, and testing workflows specific to Python projects with uv.
